data.name: Namba Parks
data.desc: A large shopping mall with the concept of a canyon. The unique appearance also appears in architectural books. There are restaurants on floors 1 to 5 and trendy shops on floors 6 to 8, and rooftop gardens on floors 8 to 9. It is an essential shopping mall in Osaka. A total area of 11,500 square meters is planted with over 70,000 trees, and at night, you can enjoy the magnificent night view of Osaka.
data.way: It is an 8-minute walk from Namba Station on the Midosuji Line, Sennichimae Line and Yotsubashi Line. Or directly connected to Nankai Namba Station.

data.name: Denden Town
data.desc: A street for otaku such as figures, models, and otaku where electronic shops are concentrated. It is like Akihabara of Tokyo.
data.way: Sennichimae Line, Sakaisuji Line Nippombashi Station or Kintetsu Line Nippombashi Station.

data.name: Dotonbori
data.desc: Osaka's largest town and town. In the past, Kabuki theater and pubs have become a dense area and have reached their present form. The Dotonbori River that stretches from east to west in Minami is full of people, but especially the nighttime with a bright night view.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Yotsubashi Line on the Midosuji Line Sennichimae. Or get off at Nipponbashi Station on the Sennichimae Line or Sakaisuji Line.

data.name: Ebisubashi
data.desc: A bridge connecting Dotonbori and Shinsaibashi. Osaka It is a place where you can take a picture in the background of a glicoman which appears without falling into a photograph. Osaka is the representative place for tourists. It is now connecting Dotonbori, a nightlife district, and Shinsaibashi, a shopping district. In 2003, people who were thrilled with Osaka's baseball home team, the Hanshin Tigers, jumped into the Dotonbori River and died. It is said that the water quality of the beautiful river is not good.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Yotsubashi Line on the Midosuji Line Sennichimae.

data.name: Shinsaibashisuji
data.desc: It is a long arcade in the north of Dotonbori. It is a typical shopping street of Osaka filled with clothes shops, restaurants, and fine shops. In the roof-topped arcade, you can see the crowds of crowds filled with crowds.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Midosuji Line, Yotsubashi Line on Sennichimae. Alternatively, get off at Shinsaibashi Station on the Midosuji Line Nagahori Tsurumiryokuchi Line.

data.name: National Bunraku Theater
data.desc: Bunraku Theater is the only one in Japan. Bunraku is Japan's three major traditional theater with Kabuki and Noah. Approximately 4 hours. It is a good idea to fill up your stomach or eat a lunch box that sells during the performance.
data.way: Sennichimae Line, Nippombashi Station of Sakaisuji Line or Nipponbashi Station of Kintetsu Line.

data.name: Ukiyo-koji alley
data.desc: It is a small alley that reproduces Dotonbori in the early 20th century in bustling Dotonbori. It is an alley made over six years, but it has a small but beautiful feel. 'Ukiyo (浮世)' is a 'fleeting world', 'the world'. It means 'tough soul'.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Midosuji Line, Sennichimae Line, Yotsubashi Line.

data.name: Don Quixote Ebisu Tower
data.desc: A large, low-cost market that sells household goods. It is an elongated building with a height of 77m. The Ferris wheel that ran above was operated in the past, but it is not operated after the accident.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Midosuji Line, Sennichimae Line, Yotsubashi Line.

data.name: Tonbori cruise ship
data.desc: Free if you have Osaka Pass. Free tickets are exchanged at a small booth next to Don Quixote. There is a limit on the number of people per day.
data.way: Get off at Namba Station on the Midosuji Line, Sennichimae Line, Yotsubashi Line. Or get off at Nipponbashi Station on the Sennichimae Line or Sakaisuji Line.

data.name: Americimura
data.desc: A shopping area filled with funky sensibility. Shops selling clothes imported from the United States were gathered to be called 'America Mura'. There are many fashion / accessory shops that are looking for 10 to 20's.
data.way: Get off at Shinsaibashi Station on the Midosuji Line and Nagahori Tsurumiryokuchi Line. Or get off at Yotsubashi Station on the Yotsubashi Line.

data.name: Midosuji
data.desc: A national highway terminating in the center of Osaka. More than 800 ginkgo trees are planted on both sides of the road. On the weekend of the second week of October, the Midosuji Parade will be held. Over 100 people from around the world will perform various performances.
data.way: Get off at Shinsaibashi Station on the Midosuji Line and Nagahori Tsurumiryokuchi Line.

data.name: Organic Building
data.desc: Building of unique appearance where piping is exposed to the outside. Plants planted in this pipe are responsible for purifying the bitter water themselves. The purified water collects in the septic tank along the piping and is purified once more through the pipe with the water purification function.
data.way: Get off at Shinsaibashi Station on the Midosuji Line and Nagahori Tsurumiryokuchi Line.
